segments.text: This scene is truly a ticking time bomb of small disasters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water relentlessly pouring from the sink, forming a dangerous puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone is definitely going to slip and fall on that wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's obliviousness to the water is astonishingly frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then there's the boy on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool looks like it could give way at any second, sending him sprawling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he falls and hits his head, or breaks the jar and cuts himself?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm quite surprised no one has reacted to these obvious hazards yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me want to shout a warning to them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of unawareness is almost unbelievable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The potential for injury and damage is really high here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can already picture the shattered dishes and the crying children.
segments.speaker: PAR
